titles.title: Providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 95) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2006, revising appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2005, and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2007 through 2010.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-19, by Mr. Putnam.

After passage of H. Con. Res. 95, it shall be in order to consider in the House S. Con. Res. 18; to move to strike all after the resolving clause of S. Con. Res. 18 and to insert the provisions of H. Con. Res. 95, as passed by the House.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 12.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 154.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 202 (Roll no. 78).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 228 - 196 (Roll no. 79).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/16/2005--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 95) establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2006, revising appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal year 2005, and setting forth appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2007 through 2010.
